intro: Caryodaphnopsis malipoensis, commonly known as the Malipo cyclobalanopsis, is a rare and endemic tree species native to Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its distinctive woody structure and unique leaf morphology. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the genus Cyclobalanopsis. It thrives in subtropical forests and is adapted to specific soil and climate conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
